title: Hybrid Feedback and Flexible Design Strategies for Personalized Language Learning in MOOCs

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level language theory background (grammar, vocabulary, pragmatics) and practical experience (writing, speaking, listening). Possession of basic digital literacy and adaptability to VR environments
context.additional_context: A VR/simulation-based language learning course in BYOD environments, emphasizing learner-specific feedback (pronunciation, expression, grammar, pragmatics) and flexible task design for large-scale language education. Focuses on cultivating contextual language use skills in simulation environments resembling real-life situations.

learning_goals: Learners will improve situational language proficiency (speaking, listening, vocabulary usage) by over 80% through VR simulations and acquire context-specific communication strategies

Learners will use blended feedback (automated scoring system + peer evaluation) to perform customized language expression improvements and grammar error corrections at least twice weekly, strengthening self-directed learning abilities through feedback implementation

Over a 1–6-month long-term course, learners will select two tasks (writing, presentation, discussion), establish personalized language learning plans using variable deadlines (extendable up to 2 weeks per task), submit at least 8 of 10 weekly learning logs, and demonstrate planning execution by achieving over 80% (4 of 5) on the final portfolio rubric criteria (grammar accuracy, vocabulary diversity, fluency, logical structure, creativity)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
